skill.name: code-review
skill.description: Perform code reviews following Sentry engineering practices. Use when reviewing pull requests, examining code changes, or providing feedback on code quality. Covers security, performance, testing, and design review.
skill.summary: Perform code reviews following Sentry engineering practices. Use when reviewing pull requests, exami...
skill.author: davila7

security_audit.summary: Pure prompt-based skill containing only code review guidelines and best practices. No executable code, no file system access, no network calls, no command execution. This skill defines AI behavior for code review tasks.

content.value_statement: Code reviews often miss security vulnerabilities and performance issues. This skill provides structured guidelines following Sentry engineering practices to identify runtime errors, N+1 queries, security gaps, and design problems.
actual_capabilities: Identify runtime errors including null pointer issues and exceptions
Detect performance problems like N+1 queries and unbounded operations
Flag security vulnerabilities such as injection attacks and XSS
Review test coverage and suggest missing test cases
Assess code design and architectural alignment
Provide constructive feedback following Sentry guidelines
limitations: Does not execute code or run tests
Cannot access external APIs or databases
Limited to reviewing code provided in conversation

use_cases.title: PR Code Review
use_cases.description: Review pull requests systematically before merging to catch bugs and quality issues early.

use_cases.title: Architecture Assessment
use_cases.description: Evaluate proposed changes for architectural consistency and long-term maintainability.

use_cases.title: Security Vulnerability Scan
use_cases.description: Identify potential security issues like injection risks and access control gaps in code changes.

prompt_templates.title: Basic PR Review
prompt_templates.prompt: Use the Sentry code review skill to review these changes. Check for runtime errors, performance issues, security vulnerabilities, and test coverage.

prompt_templates.title: Security Focused
prompt_templates.prompt: Focus on security issues. Look for injection risks, XSS, access control problems, and secrets exposure in this code.

prompt_templates.title: Performance Analysis
prompt_templates.prompt: Analyze this code for performance problems. Identify N+1 queries, O(n¬≤) operations, and unnecessary allocations.

prompt_templates.title: Comprehensive Review
prompt_templates.prompt: Perform a complete code review following Sentry practices: check for errors, performance, security, design, tests, and flag anything requiring senior engineer review.

output_examples.input: Review this Python function for a PR
output: Runtime Errors: Potential null reference on line 15 if user.profile is None
Performance: N+1 query detected in loop at line 23 - use prefetch_related
Security: Parameterized query correctly used at line 42
Tests: Missing test for edge case when user_id is empty string
Design: Function follows existing repository patterns
Recommendation: Approve with minor issues - fix null check before merge

best_practices: Provide actionable suggestions rather than vague criticism
Approve when only minor issues remain - do not block for stylistic preferences
Flag schema changes, API contracts, and security-sensitive code for senior review
anti_patterns: Blocking PRs for personal coding style preferences
Missing security review for code handling user input
Approving without checking test coverage for new functionality

faq.question: Which programming languages does this skill support?
faq.answer: The skill provides guidelines applicable to any language. Examples cover Python, Django, TypeScript, and React patterns.

faq.question: Can this skill run automated tests?
faq.answer: No, this skill reviews code statically. It does not execute code or run test suites.

faq.question: How does this integrate with my existing workflow?
faq.answer: Use it as an AI assistant during PR review. Copy code changes into conversation for analysis.

faq.question: Is my code data safe with this skill?
faq.answer: Yes, code stays in the conversation. No data is stored or transmitted externally.

faq.question: What should I do with the feedback?
faq.review: Feedback identifies issues to discuss with the author. Use suggestions to improve code before merge.

faq.question: How is this different from automated linting?
faq.answer: Linting catches syntax and style. This skill reviews logic, design, security, and architectural fit.
